p: The climate of Mayotte is marine tropical. The annual temperature varies between 25°C and 35°C, with a high annual rainfall (1500 mm) and a peak rainy season (December-March) [ 32]. Despite rainfall seasonality, the normalized difference vegetation index NDVI (a measure of vegetation density) is high and shows little annual variation (average Mayotte range 0.65–0.82, NDVI ranges 0–1) [ 33] ( S1 Fig). A continually high NDVI potentially would allow the sustenance of mosquito breeding and therefore vector transmission even during the dry season [ 34, 35]. Apart from RVF, other arboviral diseases reported are Dengue and Chikungunya [ 6].
